title: ARLAS-wui settings file validator
description: The settings file is used to configure: 1) authentication 2) persistence

use_authent.description: Defines whether to be authenticated or not

auth_mode.description: Defines which type of authentication is used. `openid` by default

force_connect.description: When authentication is enabled, this option forces to be connected to Auth0 at application bootstrap.

use_discovery.description: Defines whether we use document discovery service

client_id.description: The client's id as registered with the auth server

redirect_uri.description: The client's redirectUri as registered with the auth server

silent_refresh_redirect_uri.description: The client's silentRefreshRedirectUri as registered with the auth server

token_endpoint.description: Url of the token endpoint as defined by OpenId Connect and OAuth 2. Mandatory if use_discovery is false.

userinfo_endpoint.description: Url of the userinfo endpoint as defined by OpenId Connect. Mandatory if use_discovery is false.

jwks_endpoint.description: JSON Web Key Set (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7517) with keys used to validate received id_tokens. This is taken out of the disovery document.. Mandatory if use_discovery is false.

login_url.description: The auth server's endpoint that allows to log the user in when using implicit flow. Mandatory if use_discovery is false.

logout_url.description: Redirecting the user to this URL (https://YOUR_DOMAIN/v2/logout) clears all Single Sign-on (SSO) cookies set by Auth0 for the user. If you want to navigate the user to a specific URL after the logout, set that URL at the returnTo parameter. Check https://auth0.com/docs/api/authentication?javascript#logout

post_logout_redirect_uri.description: Redirecting the user to this URL after logout.

show_debug_information.description: Defines whether additional debug information should  be shown at the console

timeout_factor.description: Defines when the token_timeout event should be raised.If you set this to the default value 0.75, the event s triggered after 75% of the token's life time.

session_checks_enabled.description: If true, the lib will try to check whether the user is still logged in on a regular basis as described

clear_hash_after_login.description: Defines whether to clear the hash fragment after logging in.

storage.description: Defines where authentication information is stocked. `memorystorage` by default

disable_at_hash_check.description: This property has been introduced to disable at_hash checks and is indented for Identity Provider that does not deliver an at_hash EVEN THOUGH its recommended by the OIDC specs.

dummy_client_secret.description: dummy string for tests. DO NOT USE IT in production environment.

sign_up_enabled.description: Display or not the sign up button in arlas iam login page.

icon.description: Icon to use to represent the application

tooltip.description: Tooltip to display on hover of the icon

check_url.description: URL to check if the user has access to the application

check_url_response_type.description: Response type to specify for the check_url if it is different from 'json'

dashboards_shortcut.description: Whether to display a quick access list to other dashboards. Should be true only in dev mode.

max_buckets.description: Maximum number of buckets for an histogram

export_nb_buckets.description: Maximum number of buckets that can be exported

process.description: Configuration of a process for the result list

max_items.description: Number of maximum items the process can be applied to

url.description: URL of the description of the process according to OGC Processes standards
URL to query to get information about the process status

geocoding.description: Configuration of the geocoding for ARLAS

find_place_zoom_to.description: Maximum zoom that can be used to zoom on the features returned by the geocoding service
